project.name: C-C127C-FFMP-09-ST01-DT01-DF12-CF24-01
project.description: Creating test case using base program. Added an environment variable read to the function definition. Completed injection.

build_commands.command: awk -v compiler="$SS_CC" '/CC=gcc/{gsub(/gcc/, compiler)};{print}' config.mak.bak > config.mak && true

iopair.name: C-C127C-FFMP-09-ST01-DT01-DF12-CF24-01-GOOD-01
iopair.description: remove the audio from a video Has a heap buffer of size 128 within a struct. reads in an ascii string from an environmentvariable and increments the corresponding values in the heap buffer. Then reads in an input and prints out the count of the characters from the heap buff of those in the input. If input contains extended ascii characters, they will be wrapped around to negative values and the buffer will be under read

scoring_formula.formula: (GOOD-01-CENTOS OR GOOD-01-UBUNTU OR GOOD-01-DEBIAN) AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

If input contains extended ascii characters, they will be wrapped around to negative values and the buffer will be under read

process.environment_variable: This is probably not going to overflow a buffer of some sort. Let's run it anyway and see what happens.

scoring_formula.formula: (GOOD-02-CENTOS OR GOOD-02-UBUNTU OR GOOD-02-DEBIAN) AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

scoring_formula.formula: weakness_started_vVTBX8xvlcyJam9H9s0t AND ((NOT PERFORMER AND (output_excess_non_null_XDy8RHPGRk) AND NOT timeout_SRQ6XUc9hR) or (PERFORMER AND NOT ((output_excess_non_null_XDy8RHPGRk) OR timeout_SRQ6XUc9hR)))
(NOT PERFORMER AND (output_excess_non_null_XDy8RHPGRk) AND NOT timeout_SRQ6XUc9hR) or (PERFORMER AND NOT ((output_excess_non_null_XDy8RHPGRk) OR timeout_SRQ6XUc9hR))

output_checks.simple_check: if (( $(/bin/grep -P "value [\x80-\xFF] appears: 5555 times" "logfile.txt" | wc -l) > 0)); then true; else false; fi;
